checks.evaluation: Current memory system (daily logs + MEMORY.md + structured JSON + planned NOW.md) meets needs. No gaps that warrant new dependencies. Memory skills found are interesting but would add complexity without clear value-add.
checks.notes: Quality > quantity principle applied. Will revisit if specific memory limitation emerges.

checks.evaluation: Post security incident (malicious Twitter skill), searched for security audit tools. Multiple options available but NONE installed due to new Directive #7 security requirements. Supply chain attack demonstrated that even top-downloaded skills can be malicious. Will not install security tools without: 1) Jason's explicit approval, 2) Full security review per Directive #7 checklist, 3) Verification of publisher reputation.
checks.notes: New security posture: All skill installations now require manual review and approval. Trust must be verified, never assumed. This conservative approach prevents compromise while maintaining current capabilities.
